title: 6th Poona Divisional Area
text:
The 6th Poona Divisional Area was an <a href="infantry">infantry</a> <a href="Division%20%28military%29">division</a> of the <a href="British%20Indian%20Army">British Indian Army</a> that formed part of the <a href="Indian%20Army%20during%20the%20First%20World%20War">Indian Army during the First World War</a>. It was formed in October 1914 to replace the original <a href="6th%20%28Poona%29%20Division">6th (Poona) Division</a> that had been mobilized in September 1914 for service in <a href="Mesopotamian%20Campaign">Mesopotamia</a>. It was renamed as Poona Division in June 1917 and remained in India throughout the war. The division was redesignated as Poona District in 1920.
History.
At the outbreak of the <a href="First%20World%20War">First World War</a>, the <a href="6th%20%28Poona%29%20Division">6th (Poona) Division</a> was mobilized in September 1914 and sailed from <a href="Bombay">Bombay</a> on 16 October for <a href="Mesopotamian%20Campaign">Mesopotamia</a>. The 6th Poona Divisional Area was formed in October 1914 to take over the area responsibilities of the 6th (Poona) Division. It took over the units left behind by the original division and initially only commanded <a href="Bombay%20Brigade">Bombay Brigade</a>, joined by the reformed <a href="Poona%20Brigade">Poona Brigade</a> in December. However, the <a href="Ahmednagar%20Brigade">Ahmednagar Brigade</a> was not formed until May 1918, followed by the <a href="58th%20Indian%20Brigade">58th</a> and <a href="59th%20Indian%20Brigade">59th Indian Brigade</a>s in June. Bombay Brigade became independent in the same month.
The division served in India throughout the war, initially under <a href="Southern%20Command%20%28India%29">Southern Army</a>, then <a href="Southern%20Command%20%28India%29">Southern Command</a> from January 1918. From early 1918, the division was responsible for a significant part of the expansion of the <a href="British%20Indian%20Army">British Indian Army</a>.
In 1918, the division was responsible for posts and stations at <a href="Ahmednagar">Ahmednagar</a>, <a href="Anandi">Anandi</a>, <a href="Arangaon">Arangaon</a>, <a href="Belgaum">Belgaum</a>, <a href="Daund">Dhond</a>, <a href="Kirkee">Kirkee</a>, <a href="Kholapur">Kholapur</a>, <a href="Manmad">Manmad</a>, <a href="Poona">Poona</a> and <a href="Satara%20%28city%29">Satara</a>. Bombay Brigade was responsible for <a href="Ahmedabad">Ahmedabad</a>, <a href="Baroda">Baroda</a>, Bombay, <a href="Colaba">Colaba</a>, <a href="Dadar">Dadar</a>, <a href="Deolali">Deolali</a>, <a href="Nasik">Nasik</a>, <a href="Rajkot">Rajkot</a> and <a href="Santacruz%2C%20Mumbai">Santa Cruz</a>. It was renamed Poona Division in June 1917 and was redesignated as "Poona District" in June 1920.
